meanings.definition: To divide into parts or pieces
meanings.sent1: She separates the puzzle pieces carefully.
meanings.sent2: The knife easily separates the cake into slices.
meanings.sent3: The magician separates the scarf into two pieces, then magically puts them back together.
meanings.sent4: The river separates the two towns, creating a natural boundary.
meanings.sent5: The explosion violently separates the rocks, scattering them in all directions.

meanings.definition: To cause to be apart from others
meanings.sent1: The tall fence separates the backyard from the front yard.
meanings.sent2: The high wall separates the two neighboring houses.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel separates the group of birds by chasing them away.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise separates the students in the cafeteria, causing them to move to different tables.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher separates the troublemakers from the rest of the class.

meanings.definition: To distinguish or differentiate between things
meanings.sent1: The color coding separates the files based on their importance.
meanings.sent2: The unique smell of the flower separates it from the others in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The detective separates the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The taste test easily separates the good coffee from the bad.
meanings.sent5: The expert's keen eye separates the real painting from the forgery.
